title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, were charged in Brockton District Court for the September 2025 murder of Mike Jonas.
Thompson faces first degree murder charges and is held without bail; Slade charged as accessory with $250,000 bail.
The pair were arrested in Lewiston, Maine, after evading police following the fatal shooting and stabbing of Jonas in Finnegan Park.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox attempted to trade for Angels shortstop Zach Neto but couldn't meet the high asking price.
Zach Neto, 25, has delivered two consecutive 20-20 seasons and hit 49 homers over the last two years.
Boston acquired 3B/2B Caleb Durbin from the Brewers, likely positioning him at third base for the upcoming season.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, former Brockton driving school owner, sentenced to 1 day in prison for RMV bribery scheme.
Cardosa bribed RMV employee $20,000 to pass 100-300 applicants without road tests from 2019 to 2021.
Cardosa fined $5,500 and sentenced to six months home incarceration due to health issues.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B unfollowed each other on Instagram after the Patriots' Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Cardi B gave a terse 'Good luck' when asked about Diggs during the Fanatics Super Bowl party.
Diggs faces felony strangulation and misdemeanor charges, with an arraignment scheduled for February 13.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Bad Bunny's all-Spanish Super Bowl halftime show as a proud moment for Puerto Rican representation.
Bad Bunny received praise from NFL commissioner Roger Goodell despite criticism from Donald Trump regarding the performance choice.
Cora highlighted cultural elements in the performance, stating Bad Bunny respected and united different parts of America.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released body cam footage of police response to the Brown University shooting that killed two in December.
The footage shows Providence Police Lt. Patrick Potter coordinating the police response and medical aid during the active shooter incident.
Claudio Manuel Neves Valente, the shooter, killed two students at Brown and an MIT professor before dying by suicide.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Former Patriots lineman Keion White was shot in the ankle in San Francisco and underwent surgery Monday morning.
The shooting occurred after the Super Bowl at Levi’s Stadium; no arrests have been made yet, according to police.
This incident marks the second time in 18 months that a 49ers player has been a shooting victim in San Francisco.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum assigned to Maine Celtics for practice as part of recovery from Achilles tendon rupture.
Tatum has been participating in controlled 5-on-5 scrimmages, indicating progress in his rehab.
Boston Celtics currently tied with Knicks for second in Eastern Conference with 34-19 record.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers were rescued from Camel's Hump mountain in Duxbury, Vermont, amid sub-zero temperatures and deep snow.
A 21-year-old man and 19-year-old woman were suffering from hypothermia when found by rescue teams around 11:20 p.m.
The man walked down the trail after warming up; the woman was stretchered and hospitalized but is expected to recover.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim to strengthen the offensive line after quarterback Drake Maye was sacked six times in Super Bowl LX.
New England plans to build depth and add offensive weapons for Drake Maye through the draft and free agency.
Patriots considering new contracts for top players such as Christian Gonzalez, while evaluating other free agent retention.
